  Return true when exactly one validation check evaluates to true.

# function: exactly_one_valid

Accepts a list of boolean validation results and returns true only when exactly one element is true.

## Example Usage

```terraform
locals {
  checks = [
    provider::validatefx::email("alice@example.com"),
    provider::validatefx::email("invalid"),
    provider::validatefx::email("bob@example.com"),
  ]

  exactly_one_valid = provider::validatefx::exactly_one_valid(local.checks)
}

output "exactly_one_valid_example" {
  value = local.exactly_one_valid
}
```

## Signature

<!-- signature generated by tfplugindocs -->
```text
exactly_one_valid(checks list of bool) bool
```

## Arguments

<!-- arguments generated by tfplugindocs -->
1. `checks` (List of Boolean, Nullable) List of boolean validation results to evaluate.
